sentences: Pea need aastad ei lähe 'need aastad lähevad ruttu'.
Tõug juba kollane, ja kui pead vihma ei tule, ega ole ka sealt võtta midagi.
translation: must (second-person singular present indicative of pidama)
context: 'Pead' has multiple meanings in Estonian depending on context. It can be the partitive singular form of 'pea' meaning head, or it can be the nominative plural form of 'pea' also meaning heads. Additionally, it is the second-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'pidama' which means to hold/must/should.
